segments.text: I see the woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate and not paying attention to anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even notice the water overflowing and spilling onto the floor, creating a big puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn't seem to feel it, it's like she's in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like that, it must be a while by now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking cookies behind her back and trying not to get caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don't get caught, but I also hope they don't hurt themselves, it's a tricky situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar and it looks like he could fall any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks like it could tip over any second and that would be bad, I don't want to see that happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting patiently, her hand outstretched for a cookie, she's so well-behaved and sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed any of this, it's really surprising and almost unbelievable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside, it's like two different worlds colliding.
segments.speaker: PAR
